title: Big Wine Estates in Small Town Napa Valley
text: Sixty-five miles north of San Francisco and nestled between the Mayacamas and Vaca Mountain ranges, St. Helena is a scenic, 4-square-mile city centrally located in the heart of Napa Valley wine country. A significant portion of the town’s roughly 6,000 people reside in the area year-round, from farmworkers to families with children. Silicon Valley executives have second homes here, and out-of-towners have vacation properties. Main Street, which has historic buildings dating back to the late 1800s and early 1900s, is lined with coffee shops, bakeries and restaurants, as well as clothing, jewelry and home boutiques. And...
description: California’s St. Helena is a charming community with luxe residential properties, vineyard views included
